tagline: AI Researcher • Medical Imaging • Deep Learning
research_interests: Deep learning for medical image analysis, transformer-based diagnostic models, privacy-preserving AI, uncertainty estimation in healthcare applications.
about_me: Passionate about bridging cutting-edge AI with real clinical impact. Currently focused on robust, interpretable models for radiology and pathology. Outside the lab: cycling, photography, and Persian poetry.

education.title: Ph.D. in Artificial Intelligence
education.content:
Thesis: Transformer-based uncertainty-aware diagnosis in medical imaging
Advisor: Prof. Dr. Maria Jansen
GPA: 9.8/10

education.title: M.Sc. in Computer Science
education.content:
Specialization: Machine Learning & Computer Vision
Thesis: Self-supervised learning for MRI reconstruction
Graduated cum laude

work_experience.title: Research Assistant
work_experience.content:
• Developed NeuralDiagnosis: a transformer-based diagnostic engine achieving 94% accuracy on private datasets
• Published 3 first-author papers at MICCAI and NeurIPS workshops
• Led collaboration with Amsterdam UMC radiologists

work_experience.title: Machine Learning Engineer (Intern)
work_experience.content:
• Improved MRI reconstruction pipeline using diffusion models
• Reduced inference time by 40% while maintaining diagnostic quality
• Co-authored internal patent application

featured_project.title: NeuralDiagnosis Engine
featured_project.description: End-to-end transformer architecture for multi-modal medical diagnosis with built-in uncertainty quantification and privacy-preserving federated learning capabilities.
featured_project.tech: PyTorch • MONAI • Transformers • Federated Learning • Docker
featured_project.features:
• 94% accuracy on internal radiology dataset
• Calibrated uncertainty via conformal prediction
• Differential privacy guarantees
• Real-time inference (<200ms)

publications.title: Federated Learning for Privacy-Preserving Medical AI

certificates: Stanford Online: AI in Healthcare Specialization
